intro: Seseli dubium, commonly known as the doubtful seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbrella-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is native to parts of Europe and Asia. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of other members of the carrot family. Seseli dubium is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
